question.title: Jakarta Persistence can't find Entity classes
question.body:
I'm trying to update my old Java EE project to run on Jakarta EE and I've run into an issue I can't seem to resolve. When I use the persistence for Jakarta the compiler says it can't find the classes for my annotations, for example @Entity, @NamedQueries etc. I get the error:

java: cannot find symbol symbol: class Entity

I get this despite having the Jakarta imports. I also have this in my POM:

<dependency>
      <groupId>jakarta.persistence</groupId>
      <artifactId>jakarta.persistence-api</artifactId>
      <version>3.2.0</version>
      <scope>provided</scope>
  </dependency>

I am using JDK11 and Glassfish 7.0.2.4

I can see the Entity and other classes if I mouseover the import jakarta.persistence.*; import so I'm a bit confused why it won't compile.

Any help is much appreciated.

answers.body:
Probably it's a compatibility error. Jakarta 3.2.0 was generated for Java 17+. If you're using Java 11, then the compiler won't be able to read the .class files inside the JAR.

You can check it here: https://jakarta.ee/specifications/persistence/3.2/ , on the section "Minimum Java SE Version".

Try using Jakarta 3.1.0 or another version that is compatible with JDK 11

question_comments.body: I can very much recommend using the bom dependency mvnrepository.com/artifact/jakarta.platform/…, since Glassfish 7 is a JakartaEE 10 server. You are pulling in persistence-api 3.2.0, which is part of JakartaEE 11. It likely won't solve your problem, but it is a clear indicator your global problem is going to be that your pom is a mess of versions.
Is that output from your IDE or Maven? You might just need to reimport the project depending on your IDE.
